activities.loc: Waushara Co. Courthouse 2nd Floor Room 215, Branch 2

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gabriel Miguel Valverde

records.addlTxt: Letter to Court from DE's wife regarding no contact order

Case called @ 10:30 AM: Defendant Gabriel Miguel Valverde appeared by Zoom, in custody. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court regarding appointment of counsel. The DE does wish to have counsel. The Court will take steps to secure counsel for the DE. The Court finds good cause exists to adjourn the AIA to allow more time for counsel to be appointed. AIA scheduled - NOH & Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency given.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Case called @ 2:44 PM: Defendant Gabriel Miguel Valverde appeared by Zoom, in custody. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. DE questioned regarding counsel. DE is eligible for SPD services, an attorney has not yet been appointed. The Court will adjourn the IA for today to allow SPD time to appoint counsel. AIA scheduled - NOH given.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Case called @ 1:16 PM Defendant Gabriel Miguel Valverde appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Gabriel Miguel Valverde.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders $2000 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
